poem:
**The Arena**  
 
In a glint of blade and steel,  
youth barters breaths in the dark.  
We erect temples of spectacle,  
purveyors of despair's dread art.  
In Canary Wharf's cradle, echoes  
rise, a gluttonous city's new hymn.  
Witness: the scripted dance of fate,  
where innocence pays for the sin.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Electrifying experience’: stage version of The Hunger Games to open in new London theatre A new theatre in London’s Canary Wharf will open with the delayed world premiere of The Hunger Games, based on Suzanne Collins’ bestselling 2008 novel and the hit 2012 film version. Irish playwright Conor McPherson’s adaptation of the dystopian adventure, which follows teenagers fighting to the death in a televised spectacle, will begin previews on 20 October. The purpose-built, 1,200-seat Troubadour". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
